sentence.text: regulation of phosphate transport excess induces hypophosphatemia via impaired phosphate reabsorption in the renal proximal tubules and decreased phosphate absorption in the intestines.

Among these diseases, X-linked hypophosphatemia (proteolysis), which is caused by inactivating mutations in the phosphate-regulating endopeptidase homolog, X-linked (proteolysis) gene, is the most prevalent form of genetic regulation of phosphate transport-related hypophosphatemic rickets.

Another clinically relevant form of regulation of phosphate transport-related hypophosphatemic disease is tumor-induced osteomalacia (TIO), a paraneoplastic syndrome associated with regulation of phosphate transport-producing tumors.
